title: Chord: Minor 6th in B (Shape: E)
content:
## Chord: Minor 6th in B (Shape: E)

### Introduction
The Minor 6th chord in the key of B is a beautiful harmony that adds a touch of sophistication and melancholy to your music. When played in the E shape, it creates a rich and mellow sound that can evoke a range of emotions. 

### Notes and Intervals
The Minor 6th chord in B consists of the following notes:
- B (Root)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Major 6th)

### Genre and Flavor
This chord is commonly used in jazz, blues, and R&B music. It adds a jazzy and soulful flavor to your compositions, making it perfect for creating moodier and emotional musical landscapes. The Minor 6th chord in B can work well as a substitution for other minor chords, adding depth and complexity to your harmonic progressions.

### Songs Featuring the Minor 6th in B (Shape: E)
1. **"Fly Me to the Moon" by Frank Sinatra**: This timeless jazz standard features the Minor 6th chord in B, adding a sophisticated and romantic touch to the arrangement.
   
2. **"Stormy Monday" by T-Bone Walker**: This classic blues tune showcases the emotive quality of the Minor 6th chord in B, enhancing the bluesy feel of the song.
   
3. **"If I Ain't Got You" by Alicia Keys**: In this R&B ballad, the Minor 6th chord in B (played in the E shape) helps create a soulful and introspective atmosphere that complements the heartfelt lyrics.
